S.FORM: ’ita’ saboeh kayzaeh. kaysa’an yako ’am tomortoroe’ ’inimon nak’ino’ noka ka’alnoSaySiyat mayaka:i’ ka kasi’aelen.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的賽夏語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say SaySiyat for food.

S.FORM: So’o ra:am ay kamatortoroe’ mayaka:i’ ka kano’?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: kamatortoroe’ yako haSa’. kayzaeh ay payaka:i’ naehan?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: ya:o ’okay bazae’. kayzaeh ay paksobae:oh ka kapanabih.
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: kita’ ka hini! tani ma’an ka pinayaka:i’ panabih.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.

S.FORM: kamatortoroe’, ya:o mangowip ila maraS ka kaka:at.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: kamatortoroe’, ya:o mangowip ila maraS ka tati:iS.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: Sibae:aeh ka tati:iS kan niSo’ kapa’onhaelan.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: kaysa’an papayhini ila, pil’awan! rim’aen takakita’ naehan.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，明天再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: yako ’in ta:in a korkoring, yako Sin ’atawen.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of ta:in, and my name is ’ataw.

S.FORM: yako ’in baSi’ a kamakiSka:at, yako Sin ’ataw en.
S.TRANSL: I am a student of baSi’, my name is ’ataw.
He is my brother, and his name is ’oemaw.

S.FORM: siya kapa’onhaelan ma’an, siya Sin hewen en.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是hewen。
She’s a friend of mine, her name is hewen.

S.FORM: siya lampez o roSa’ tinal’oemaeh ila.

S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?
我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

S.FORM: So’o hayza ay ka minatini’ kamanra:an?

S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.
你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: niSo’ minatini’ minkoringan hayza ay matawaw?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?
他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?
Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: niSo’ minayti’ minkoringan kiSka:at ila ay?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?
Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: So’o rowaSek ki niSo’ yaba’ ki ’oya’ ay?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?^
Do you live with your mom and dad? ^

S.FORM: ’ihi’, yako rowaSek ki yaba’ ki ’oya’ ma’an.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: So’o rowaSek ki niSo’ baki’ ki koko’ ay?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?
不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: ya:o mae’onhal rowaSek ki ma’an yaba’, ’oya’ ki minatini’ kamanra:an.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.
Our tribe is at the Sky Lake.
你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: ya:o ray haba:an kaSangayan lobih ray hito’.
S.TRANSL: I go back to the tribe for the summer.

S.FORM: hahila: kas’oehaz ila, rikrika: a tomal.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: kaysa’an ’okik kaskes ma’ ’okik rikrika:, kayzaeh a tomal.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: kawaS ’oka’ ka homom, bintoe’an kas’oehaz ila.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: baba:aw mintawaeh, hahila: kas’oehaz ila, haleb noka haebon ma’ kas’oehaez ila.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
What's the weather like where you are?

S.FORM: niya’om rini’ ba:i’ wa’isan a tomal.
S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

S.FORM: kawaS maskes a tomal, pak’akoey ka hiniba:.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.
I'm going to get out of here.
等一下會下大雨，你要帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you need to bring an umbrella.
剛剛有打雷，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was a thunderstorm just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.
好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: hayza ay ’omoral? So’o ’ampowa’ mintatapoS ka basang?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了？
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: ’isahini ray latar ’omoral ila, yako ’okay ’araS ka ra:ma’.
S.TRANSL: 現在外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: ba:i’ sobae:oh a tomal, hoba:in yako biSbiS ka ta’oeloeh.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: hahila: tiS’a’i’ a tomal, ya:o min’alewez ila.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: yako mangowip ila maraS ka hahowar.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.
I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.

S.FORM: ’ita’ ta’ila tabae:iw ka kaka:at kayzaeh ay?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?
Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: ’ita’ ta’ila tabae:iw ka kasi’aelen kayzaeh ay?

S.TRANSL: No, I’ve already eaten at home.

S.FORM: yako mangowip ila kinrika: ka linaSo’.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to heat up my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: ’ita’ ta pa’onhael si’ael ka linaSo’ ma’an.
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let’s eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: yako ’am somi’ael noka kakiSka:atan tinal’awan ka kasi’aelen.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: yako hayza maraS ka linaSo’, ’ita’ ma’onhael tasi’ael.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!
Let’s go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: ’ita’ ta’ila ta Sembet ka mali’ kayzaeh ay?

S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.
Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: yako mam somapoeh, torong hi ’oemaw mari’ ’iniSo’.
S.TRANSL: I was sweeping the floor and you asked ’oemaw to help you with it.
The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: hiza hinohaes hara:i’, Sa’ila ti:iS naehan.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.
等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.
I’m going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: kakiSka:atan patae’aes ila, So’o SiS kano’?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: yako ’am rima’ ma:tol ki kapa’onhaelan ma’an.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: kakiSka:atan patae’aes ila, siya SiS ka kano?

S.TRANSL: May I ask if pae:aeh is at home?
She’s at home, please come in.
May I ask if pae:aeh is at home?

S.FORM: siya ’okik ray taew’an, So’o hayza’ kano’ ka howaw?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?
Grandpa, I’m ’away, please open the door.

S.FORM: toway, yako hi ’okay, ya:o mowa:i’ rini ’am makakSiyae’ ki So’on.
S.TRANSL: toway, I’m ’okay, I’ve come to play with you.
是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: ’a:ay! hini boway kita’en kayzaeh si’aelen o.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很好吃。

S.FORM: ’ihi’, sa’oewaz si’aelen kayzaeh a tomal o.
ni ’oya’ tinikinSa:o’ kayzaeh ila, wa’ila ta si’ael ila.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll wash my hands first.

S.FORM: pak’akoy ka somi’ael ki rinae’oe:, ’izi’ kaSikar.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

S.FORM: yako somi’ael kin ’akoy Sanbaba:ok a tomal.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: yako ’am lobih ila, So honasamez ’am mowa:i’ naehan komita’ ’iSo’on.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，有空再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you again sometime.

S.FORM: ’a:ay, So: honasamez wa:i’ naehan ray taew’an ma’an pakaSiyae’.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: ’ita’ saboeh kayzaeh, kaysa’an yako ’am maraS ’inimon rima’ ray ’asang somingozaw ka tatini’.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.
好喔!我們要跟耆老說賽夏語。
Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.
你們會說賽夏語啊!真是太棒了!

S.FORM: ’ita’ saboeh kayzaeh, kaysa’an kamatortoroe’ ’am maraS hi moyo rima’ ray kapamowa’an ka tata’ matawaw.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: wa’ila rini, ’i:zi ngowip ’araS ka kakrangi’an nom matawaw.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: ’a:ay, kamatortoroe’, yami hayza’ mari’ ka kakrangi’an.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: So’o Sa’ila mari’ nom Somowaw ka kabkabaehae:.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: ’ita’ saboeh kayzaeh, kaysa’an ’ita’ ’am rima’ ray kaSopanan ka Sinpanan.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.
好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: wa’ila rini, ’am bae:iw ka pinaSkira:a’ kina:at.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來這裡，我們準備買票。
Everyone come here, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: ray kati’aelae’ kakita’an ka kabkabaehae:, ray hikor kakita’an ka Siba:i’, moyo nonak Sa’ila kita’.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: kayzaeh, So’o Sa’ila kita’ ka kabkabaehae:.
S.TRANSL: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: ’ita’ ’aehae’ ka Sinepe: sizaeh lobih rini raroton.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: ya:o komita’ ’akoy ka Siba:i’ ki kabkabaehae:.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.
Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: ’ita’ roSa’ ta’ila ta lalangoy kayzaeh ay?
S.TRANSL: 我們兩個一起去游泳好嗎?
Let’s go swimming together, shall we?
There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: risaza ka ralom ’i:zo’ a tomalan, ’ita’ rini lalangoy kayzaeh ila.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

S.FORM: yaba’ seme:ez ka koroma’ pama’ ’iyakin rima’.
siya ray homawan nak’ino’ rima’ ray kakiSka:atan?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: siya papama’ ka kalihapoyan rima’ ray kakiSka:atan.
S.TRANSL: He took a train to school.

S.FORM: koko’ So’o nak’ino’ rima’ bae:iw ka tatimae’?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: siya seme:ez ka ’otobay rima’ bae:iw ka tatimae’.
S.TRANSL: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: yako ’am papama’ ka palono’ rima’ lan’i’.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: siya ’am papama’ ka hikoki’ rima’ lan’i’.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: siya ’am papama’ ka kano’ rima’ taka:o’?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: siya papama’ ka kapaytapari’pari’an rima’ taka:o’.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: siya papama’ ka kalihapoyan rima’ ray taytong ay’?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ’ihi’ siya papama’ ka kalihapoyan rima’ taytong.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: siya rima’ ray taytong papama’ ka kalihapoyan ay?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ’oka’, siya papama’ ka hikoki’ rima’ taytong.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: hani hayza ay ka’ayna:a’an ka baSe’?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: hayza, payhini lososo:oy panra:an ma’ ’am komita’ ka ka’ayna:a’an ka baSe’.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: hani ’ima ’al’alihan ka ka’ayna:a’an ka kalihapoyan hayno’?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的火車站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest train station to here?

S.FORM: rini ’oka’ ka ka’ayna:a’an ka kalihapoyan, So’o kayzaeh papama’ ka takoSi’ nanaw.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有火車站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no train station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: papama’ ka baSe’ ’am koza’ kin honaehnge: potngor ray kakiSka:atan?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: ’am hihingha’an ka Sinepe: ’am potngor ray kakiSka:atan.
papama’ kapaytapari’pari’an ’am koza’ kin honaehnge: potngor ray tayzong?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?
I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: seme:ez ka kapapama’an rima’ ’o:lay honaehnge: ay?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: So’o papama’ ka kalihapoyan mowa:i’ ray taew’an ma’an ’am koza’ kin honaehnge:?
S.TRANSL: 你搭火車來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by train?

S.FORM: So’o ra:am ay seme:ez ka ritinSiya’?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?
Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: So’o hila:an honasamez ay? ya:o ’am rima’ komita’ ’iSo’on kayzaeh ay?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?
Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: So’o rim’aen honasamez ay? ya:o ’iyakina somingozaw ’iSo’on noka SaySiyat ka kinbazae’an.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於賽夏族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legend of the Saisiat.

S.FORM: rim’aen ya:o ’am rima’ ray ’os’oso’an, ’okik ray taew’an o.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

S.FORM: yako bazae’ So’o ra:am noka SaySiyat ka kaspengan, ’iyakina somingozaw ’iSo’on.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對賽夏族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I’ve heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Saisiat and would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: ma’an kinra:aman ’okik ’akoy, ’ana nakhini ma’an tiniSkobae:oh ma’ ’am Sae’te:.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: tasingozaw ’iSo’on ya:o kayzaeh ay ’omalingo’? nakhini kayzaeh mayhael hayza’ ka ’inalingo’ kakita’en.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: yako monae’hea’ o maykaSpat tinal’oemaeh ila.

S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是賽夏族人嗎?
Is your wife also a SaySiyat?
我會說賽夏語和泰雅語。

S.FORM: kaysa’an kinSiyae’ somingozaw ’iSo’on, payaka:i’ naehan nom ’omalep ka tiyawan kayzaeh ay?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?
好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: ma’alo’, niSo’ kaysa’an ka tinotoroe’ kayzaeh a tomal.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: ma’an pinanabih mina sa’owaz a tomal, noka tatini’ Sinbil ka pinayaka:i’.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: kaysa’an ka siningozaw papayhini, ma’alo’ a tomal niSo’ ka pinakra:am.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: yako ’am lobih ila, pakSiwa’ So: mowa:i’ naehan ’akoy ka baezae’en kinbazae’an.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

S.FORM: So’o kayzaeh ay, So’o ’am bae:iw ka kano?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a cup.

S.FORM: So’o kayzaeh ay, So’o ’am bae:iw ka kano?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: ya:o ’am bae:iw ka talobong, nimon hayza ay kabae:iwen?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: moyo hayza ay titibae:iw ka pinlong?

S.TRANSL: No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: yako ’am bae:iw roSa’ noka binbiniSitan tinaebo’ ka ’abora’.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.
How many pounds do you want to buy?
How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.
I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: hini minayngaso’ to:o’ ila nanaw ka binotoe’, ’iniSo’ ila hahi:il.
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!
How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: saboeh Sepe:en Sam’iyaeh o ’aehae’ rayhil, be:ay So: Sam’iyaeh rayhil ma’ kayzaeh ila.
yako ’am bae:iw naehan sowiti’, pak potngor ’aehae’ kaboehoel rayhil.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: saboeh haseb kaboehoel o lampez rayhil.
Sepe: ’iniman haseb kaboehoel rayhil kayzaeh ay?
hini wa’isan a tomal, kayzaeh ay waelae’ sowiti’?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?
不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: hini walo’ mato:ol rayhil, ’am bae:iw naehan ay ka ’aroma’ kakrangi’an?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

S.FORM: ya:o kayzaeh ay Somibae:aeh kanSo’ ka rayhil?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?
Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: yako mangowip maraS ka rayhil, yako kayzaeh ay Somibae:aeh kanSo’ ka rayhil?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?
I don’t have any money either!

S.FORM: yako mangowip maraS ka rayhil, yako kayzaeh ay Somibae:aeh kanSo’ ka rayhil?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: kayni’! Sa’la’ paSibae:aeh ka rayhil ’iSo’on ’okay pinobih ’iyakin.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven’t paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: yako kayzaeh ay Somibae:aeh ka ’inSo’o’a ka kayba:en?
ya:o kayzaeh ay Somibae:aeh ka ’inSo’a ka kina:at?

S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?
Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: ’omoral ila, yako ’okay ’araS ka ra:ma’, paSibae:aeh ’iyakin ka ra:ma’ kayzaeh ay.
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It’s raining, I don’t have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

S.FORM: ma’an ’aehae’ nanaw ka ra:ma’, ’ita’ roSa’ tapa’onhael tira:ma’!
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let’s stick together!

S.FORM: hini niSo’ Sa’la’ pinaSibae:aeh ka kina:at, kapinobih ’iSo’on.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: So: ’iyakinita’ kano’ kina:at ma’ kayzaeh payaka:i’ ’iyakin.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.
When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: kayzaeh, So: So’o hayza ila ka rayhil ’isa:a’ pinobih ila.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It doesn’t matter, you can talk about it when you have money.
When are you going to pay me back?
I’ll return it to you tomorrow.
When are you going to return my book?
我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn’t I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: hini kaka:at ni ta:in pinaSibae:aeh ’iSo’on ay?
S.TRANSL: Did ta:in lend you this pen?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: hini kaka:at niSo’ Sinibae:aeh kala ’obay ay?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from ’obay?
No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: ’oka’ ila ka timo’, Sa’ila Sibae:aeh kala toway sowiti’ ka timo’.
S.TRANSL: We’re out of salt, so let’s go borrow some salt from toway.

S.FORM: payaka:i’ hi hewen pinobih ka rayhil.
S.TRANSL: Go tell hewen to give me my money back.
How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: yako ’am rima’ ray katatimae’an mamowa’ ka tatimae’.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: ’akoy ka hinbetel, yako ’am SomikSik ka hinbetel, ’insa’an kaporalomon naehan.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

S.FORM: mari’ ka malat ki tatawae’ ’iniman kayzaeh ay?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: baba:aw ma’an pina’inibih ka ra:i’, ’insa’an ka tokoeho’on ila.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: niSo’ pinamowa’ tatimae’ kayzaeh ila ay?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: hini polisoy kayzaeh ila kamari’in, hiza’ Sina’ ’i’ini’ ka mari’in.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.
哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
(sighs) Wow! You dug up so many gourds.
Will you help me with the barn?
We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.
魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?
I shoot fish with a spear.
Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: yako rengreng noka baseng romakep ka kaSnay’oes’oeso’an. mak’aehae’ noka wawatos, maraS ka ’aehoe’ rima’ ’omalep.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: hini hayza noka waliSan ka Sinarakan, ’isa:a’ pinayziza’an noka waliSan.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: Sakita’ mita’ ka binaseng, nakhara hayza kaSnay’oes’oeso’an pateleng ila.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.
狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.
你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: hini noka bato’ ’inopi: binasang, nom romakep ka ’aewhaeS.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.
你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: hiza Sinotalnga’ binaseng, niya’om nom romakep ka hako’.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: ma’alo’ ila ka tatini’, kaysa’an niya’om minari’ ka ’inalep ’akoy.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.
是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: kaysa’an yako ’am tomortoroe’ ’inimon nak’ino’ noka SaySiyat mayaka:i’ ka kaSnay’oes’oeso’an.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的賽夏語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in SaySiyat language today.

S.FORM: kaysa’an ya:o ’am tomortoroe’ ’inimon nak’ino’ noka SaySiyat mayaka:i’ ka hinbetel ki kaehoy.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的賽夏語怎麼說。

S.FORM: kaysa’an yako ’am tomortoroe’ ’inimon nak’ino’ malnoSaySiyat mayaka:i’ ka boway.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的賽夏族怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in SaySiyat language today.
Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

S.FORM: ki ray kabih kapa’onhaelan pa’onhael kita’ ka kina:at.
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: ’ita’ ’am patae’aes ila kiSka:at , ’am lobih ray taew’an ’iya’azem.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.
我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: ’ita’ saboeh kayzaeh, ma’an raro:o’ Sin kalihin.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is kalih.

S.FORM: yako ’in baSi’ a ’oya’, yako hi kizaw.
yako ’in baSi’ a minayti’ minkoringan ma’an raro:o’ Sin ’api’in.
S.TRANSL: 我是baSi’的妹妹，我的名字是’api’。
I am baSi’’s sister. My name is api’.

S.FORM: siya minatini’ kamanra:an ma’an, siya Sin bo:ongen.
minatini’ minkoringan niSo’ raro:o’ Sin hiya’en?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: niSo’ minayti’ minkoringan raro:o’ Sin hiya’en?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: ma’an minayti’ minkoringan raro:o’ Sin towayen.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is toway.

S.FORM: So’o ra:am ay nisiya ka raro:o’?
minatini’ kamanra:an niSo’ haysani piza’ ila tinal’oemaeh?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: siya lampez o haseb tinal’oemaeh ila.
minayti’ kamanra:an niSo’ piza’ ila tinal’oemaeh?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?
Do you have schools in your community?
你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: ’ihi’, ray kakiSka:atan kiSka:at yami saboeh nak ’aehae’ taew’an mae’iyaeh.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.
你的媽媽從事什麼工作?
你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: ’oka’, siya ’in ’inoka minayti’ ma’an a ka kapa’onhaelan.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.
No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: yako ’oka’ ka minayti’ kamanra:an, ya:o hayza’ to:o’ minayti’ minkoringan.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: kawaS maskes, pa’akoy rae’oe: ka ’ima rikrika: ralom.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: kawaS rikrika:, pak’akoy rae’oe: ka ralom.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: hahila: tiS’a’i’ , ’izi’ ngowip poti’ ka hahila:.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.
There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: rim’aen ’oka’ ka hahila:, ’akoy ka homom, wa’isan ka ba:i’.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: hini kawaS masmaskesan So: kaSlatar hiba: ka katoeh.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?
那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.
The rain stops and the sun comes out.
It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: ’isahini ’oka’ ka ’a’oral, hila:an ila ’isa:a’ ’am ’omoral, So: ’am kaSlatar ’araS ka ra:ma’.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.
Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: ’ihi’, koe’hael ray ’amiSan ’am maskes a tomalan, pak’akoy hiba: ka kayba:en.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.
Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: ’ihi’, haba:an ’am rikrika: a ta:an, pak’akoy rae’oe: ka ralom.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: yako minowa’ ka naba:an, kawaS ha:olhoel.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: yako ’okay minowa’ ka na’miSan, ray na’miSan ’akoy ka ba:yoS.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

S.FORM: ya:o mangowip ila maraS ka kina:at.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the textbook.

S.FORM: yako ’am ki So’o ma’onhael komita’ ka kina:at.
S.TRANSL: I will share it with you.

S.FORM: yako mangowip ila maraS ka tati:iS.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the eraser.

S.FORM: So’o mangowip ila maraS ka kaka:at ay?
S.TRANSL: Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: ’ihi’, So’o paSibae:aeh ka kaka:at ’iyakin kayzaeh ay?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?
你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.
No, we have to carry books first.
Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

S.FORM: So’o bahi’ ila ay ka powawan?

S.TRANSL: Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: So’o patae’aes ’am kakiSka:atan ’am powa’ ka kano?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: siya patae’aes ’am kiSka:at ’am powa’ ila ka kano?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: lalaw ’okik ray taew’an o! yako hewen, So’o hayza’ kano’ ka howaw? siya So: lobih ila ya:o tapayaka:i’ ila hi lalaw.
S.TRANSL: lalaw不在家耶!我是hewen，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告lalaw。
lalaw is not at home. I am hewen. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: koko’, yami hi ’away ki lalaw, hawaeh ka ’a’eleb ’iniya’om!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是'away 和 lalaw，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are ’away as and lalaw, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: yako ’ataw, yako mowa:i’ komi:im hi baSi’.
S.TRANSL: I am ’ataw, I am here for baSi.
Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: So’o honaehnge: ila ’okay wa:i’, ya:o maSriyae’ ’iSo’on a tomal.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: lalaw, yako mowa:i’ ila makakSiyae’ ki So’o.
S.TRANSL: lalaw, I am here to play with you.
Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: hini ma’an pinamowa’ ka ’aewpir, Santalam naehan.
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: wa’ila! hini ma’an pinamowa’ ka boway, Santalam.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: Sa:eng! hini ma’an pinamowa’ ka baesaeh Santalam naehan!
S.TRANSL: 請坐!這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: yako ’aewhay somi’ael ka ’iyok, ya:o somi’ael ka linko kayzaeh ila.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.
Let me peel the fruit for you.
Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: pak’akoy si’ael, ma’an tinalek ka tatimae’ ’akoy o.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: wa! sa’oewaz kayzaeh kasazeken, ma’ kayzaeh kasi’aelen.
S.TRANSL: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.
Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.
Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: yako Sanbaba:ok a tomal, kayni’ somi’ael ila.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: kaysa’an kamatortoroe’ ’am maraS ’inimon rima’ ray koko:ol.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.
媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: kamatortoroe’ kaysa’an ’am maraS ’inimon rima’ ray pinatiyay.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: yami ’am rima’ manibih ay ka ra:i’ ?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?
Teacher will take us to the riverside.
Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?
不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?
不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: kamatortoroe’, ’ita’ ray ba:la’ ’am komita’ ka kano’?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: kamatortoroe’, ’ita’ rima’ ray koko:ol ’am komita’ ka kano’?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: ’ita’ ’am rima’ ray pinatiyayan komita’ mita’ pinamowa’ ka basaeh, ’iya’azem ka ’ae’aewzaeh ki walwalo’ o.
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.
老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?
No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: kamatortoroe’ ’ita’ ’am rima’ ray pinatiyayan mamowa’ ka por’oe’ ay?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: yako kaysa’an ila komita’ ka ’ima ’i’iyaeh ka ’ayloSay.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: hiza hayza’ ka papa:o’ mam homayhayap.
wa! ya:o minowa’ ka papa:o’, kayzaeh a tomal kita’en
S.TRANSL: 耶!哇!我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.
Those are not butterflies. They are bees.
在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!
好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.
不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: yako seme:ez ka kapapama’an rima’ ray hataS.

S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: yako papama’ ka hikoki’ rima’ ray 澎湖.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: So’o nak’ino’ rima’ ray 澎湖?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: yako papama’ ka palono’ rima’ ray kabih no wasal.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: yako papama’ ka ziyae’yon lobih ray taew’an.
mowi’ papama’ ka kano’ rima’ ray kakiSka:atan?
S.TRANSL: How does mowi’ go to school?

S.FORM: mowi’ papama’ ka kalihapoyan rima’ ray kakiSka:atan.
’ataw papama’ ka kano’ rima’ ray kiyokay?
’ataw papama’ ka zitinSiya’ rima’ ray kiyokay.
So’o papama’ ka ziyae’yon ay rima’ kiSka:at?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: ’oka’, ya:o papama’ ka baSe’ rima’ kiSka:at.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: So’o papama’ ka zitinSiya’ ay rima’ kiSka:at?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: ’ihi’ yako papama’ ka zitinSiya’ rima’ kiSka:at.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: So’o papama’ ka kawti’ ay rima’ ray taka:o’?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: ’ihi’, yako papama’ ka kawti’ rima’ ray taka:o’
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: So’o rima’ ray taytong papama’ ka kalihapoyan a hikoki’?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: yako papama’ ka hikoki’, hikoki’ ’alikaeh no kalihapoyan.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: So’o rima’ ray kiyokay papama’ ka baSe’ a seme:ez ka kapapama’an?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: yako seme:ez ka kapapama’an rima’ kiyokay, nonak seme:ez kayzaeh no papama’ ka baSe’.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.
Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: ’oka’, yako seme:ez ka ’otobay rima’ ray katibae:iwan.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: kaSateran ka kina:at ’al’alihan ay ki kakiSka:atan?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: kasi’aelan ’al’alihan ay ki ka’ayna:a’an ka kapapama’an?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: kaSlatar ray ka’ayna:a’an manra:an haseb Sinepe: ’isa:a’ ma’ potngor ila.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: yako kaysa’an hayza’ ka howaw ’okik ray taew’an. So: ’inowan ila.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家。改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: So’o rim’aen honasamez ay? yako hila:an taSa’ kita’ ’iSo’on.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.
Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: yako kayzaeh ay ’omalingo’ niSo’ ka payaka:i’?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the voice recording?
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: yako ’okik kayzaeh kita’en, ma’an saksaka: ma’ ’okay tal’izaeh i, ’izi’ la.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.
Thank you for accepting the interview.
You are welcome. What would you like to know?
請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: kakhayza’an yako kinSat, ’isahini yako patae’aes ila.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: korkoring niSo’ ma’ rowaSek ray ’asang ay?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?
不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: ya:o hayza’ Sompan ’aehae’ ka ’aehoe’ ki ’aehae’ kabkabaehae:, lasiya ma’ ’aehae’ taew’an ma’an.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: ya:o ma’ hayza’ Sompan ’aehae’ ka ngiyaw, hayza’ ka kaSinpanan kayzaeh hayza’ ka kapatawawen.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: yako ’am somingozaw ’iSo’on noka kama’alep ka katiyawan.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: yako ’okik Sekla’ a tomal ka hini howaw, So: yako ra:am ma’ ’am pakSekla’ ’iSo’on.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: nimon nom ’omalep ka kakrangi’an hayza’ ay kano’ katiyawan?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: niya’om nom ’omalep ka kakrangi’an, minkoringan ’aewhay pon’a:iS.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.
那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?
不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: kalih, ray taew’an ’oka’ ila ka pinobae:aeh, So’o Sa’ila bae:iw ka pinobae:aeh.
S.TRANSL: kalih，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
kalih, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: ray katalekan hayza’ ’aehae’ naehan binbiniSitan ka pinobae:aeh, So: ’okay bae:iw ma’ kayzaeh la!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶米酒，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: ’aehae’ nanaw ’okik lal’oz, Sa’ila bae:iw roSa’ binbiniSitan naehan.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: yako ’am bae:iw ka pinobae:aeh, nimon hayza’ ay?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: yako ’am bae:iw roSa’ binbiniSitan ka pinobae:aeh, ki ’aehae’ pinotoy ka Si’Si’.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶米酒，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: Si’Si’ hini, niSo’ ’am kano’ naehan kabae:iwen?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: yako ’am bae:iw ka ’oesizo:, nimon hayza’ ay?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.
你想要什麼樣子的衣服呢?
What kind of clothes do you like?
I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: hini ’aehae’ ’ima ngangilaehan ka kayba:en kayzaeh ay?
niya’om hayza’ ’ima bolalasan ki ’ima his’alan ka kayba:en.
S.TRANSL: 我們還有白色和藍色的衣服。
We have white and blue ones too.
請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: kalih kaysa’an So’o rima’ rayno’? So’o rima’ homayaw ay?
S.TRANSL: kalih你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
kalih, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ’oka’, ya:o rima’ tatilhael hi koko’ ma’an titibae:iw ka tatimae’.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: nakhini o , rohaenan So’o honasamez ay? ’am ki yako ma’onhael komSa:o’ ay?
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起晚餐嗎?
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: kayni’, yako ’am rima’ bae:iw ka kayba:en.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: hini ’aehae’ binotoe’ ka por’oe’ koza’ rayhil?
S.TRANSL: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?
Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: be:ay ’iyakin roSa’ binotoe’ ka por’oe’ ki ’aehae’ tintin ka ’aewpir.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: kalih, yako mangowip ila maraS ka kaka:at, So’o kayzaeh ay paSibae:aeh ’iyakin?
S.TRANSL: kalih，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
kalih, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?
I don’t have one either. This is ’away’s.
那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.
Thank you and thank ’away for me.

S.FORM: yako ’am minobih ka hini roSa’ kina:at.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: yako ’am Somibae:aeh hini to:o’ ka kina:at.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: ’a:ay. to:o’ hahila: sizaeh pinobih, ’izi’ ngowip o.
S.TRANSL: 好了。三天後要拿來還，不要忘記喔。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.
You haven’t returned me the eraser.
我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了？
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: niSo’ Si: paSibae:aeh ila hi kalih ay
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to kalih?

S.FORM: kiraeh. ya:o ta somingozaw hi siya.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.
I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: ’away, hini katoeh ni kalih pinaSibae:aeh ’iniSo’ ay?
S.TRANSL: ’away, did kalih lend you this coat?
不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: ni kalih ka katoeh hingha’ ki ’inSo’o a.
S.TRANSL: kalih ’s coat is the same as yours.
他的外套是黑色的，我的不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: ’away, So’o hayza’ ay Somibae:aeh ka rayhil kala kalih?
S.TRANSL: ’away, did you borrow money from kalih?

S.FORM: hayza’, ya:o koSa’ kaysa’an ’am minobih hi siya, yako mangowip ila maraS ka rayhil.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: ma’an rim’aen ka pinobih hi siya.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.
Okay, I will tell kalih for you.

S.FORM: ’aewhaS ’am noka linanger romakep, kaehka: ’am noka talnga’ romakep, nakhini ’am kayzaeh.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: ya:o tatortoroe’ ’iSo’on ’am nak’ino’ paskayzaeh ka hini roSa’ baseng.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: ’a:ay! kayzaeh o! nakhini ya:o ma’ ’am romakep ila ka ’inalep.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: ray pinatiyay ka hinbetel ’a’ibabaw ila, So’o Sa’ila ray saksaka: mari’ ka sawki’, ’ita’ ta’ila ray pinatiyay.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: ray takil langi:, So’o kaS’abo’ ray saksaka: ma’ ’am komita’ ila.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: ’iya’azem ’am mari’, ’izi’ patipangih. hiza sawki’ soma:om a tomal.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.
我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: yako hayza’ tomiwaSaw rini, ’isa:a’ ya:o ra:am ma’an hayno binaseng.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: hini ’awbo’, niya’om ’aSkanen ray lolongan nom pit’aelaw.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: niya’om hiza ’oka’ ka ’awbo’, yami noka kapnazip romakep ka ’aelaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: yako ’inokay noka kapnazip pit’aelaw So’o tortoroe’ ’iyakin kayzaeh ay?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿釣魚，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?
好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.
I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: niSo’ kapnazip kakoway ila, nakhara ka:asen ila noka ’aelaw ! So’o ’am’amoeh hoehoeh ka kapnazip.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，好像是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: naehan, hini palono’ ’aewhay ngilol a tomal. ya:o rini tahoehoeh ka kapnazip, So’o Sa’ila riza mari’ ka ’ami’ ’iniman.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: So’o hoehoeh ka ’aelaw rini kanman ya:o tatilhaehael ’iSo’on tahoehoeh.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: tabin o! kaysa’an ’akoy ka minari’ kataboe’an ka ’aelaw mayha’ha’ ila.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.
我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.
不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: kaysa’an minay haseb ka Sinangayan, rim’aen maSangay, ta’ila tapanpanra:an!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: rim’aen ’ima minay to:o’ ka Sinangayan, rim’aen hila:an ta’ila rima’ tapakakSiyae’ ka mali’!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: rim’aen ririm’aenan So’o ’am powa’ ka kano’?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: rim’aen kaSangayan, ya:o ’am ki ’oya’ rima’ kiyokay.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.
I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: kamatortoroe’, yako biSbiS ka tiyal, ’am rima’ kata’owan.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: kamatortoroe’, yako biSbiS a tomalan ka ta’oeloeh, sizaeh ila komsi’ael ’am maSangay.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: kamatortoroe’, mowa:i’ ’aehae’ naehan minay ’aehae’ ka Sinangayan yako ’am maSangay, yako ’am rima’ pakita’ ka sinsang.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: siya biSbiS ka tiyal, siya ’ay kata’owan.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: kamatortoroe’, ’obay biSbiS ka kaSlar, kaysa’an maSangay.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, ’obay has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: yako ta:in a kalih, ’isahini yako lampez tinal’oemaeh ila.
S.TRANSL: 我叫ta:in a kalih，我今年10歲。
My name is ta:in a kalih, and I’m 10 years old.
What ethnic group are you from?
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?
是的，我們全家都是賽夏族人。
Yes, my whole family is SaySiyat.
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?
不是，我的爸爸是賽夏族，我的媽媽是客家人。
No, my father is SaySiyat, and my mother is Hakka.

S.FORM: hiza ’aehae’ mae’iyaeh ’inSo’a yaba’ ay? siya piza’ ila tinal’oemaeh?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: ’ihi’, siya ’inmana’a yaba’, siya monSayboSi: tinal’oemaeh ila.
S.TRANSL: 是的，他是我的爸爸。他六十歲了。
Yes, he is my father. He is 60 years old.

S.FORM: hiza ’aehae’ mae’iyaeh ’inSo’a yaba’ ay? siya piza’ ila tinal’oemaeh?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: ’oka’, siya tatini’ noka hito’ mita’, siya monmaykaSpat tinal’oemaeh ila.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: minatini’ kamanra:an niSo’ piza’ ila tinal’oemaeh?
minatini’ kamanra:an ma’an lampez o maykaSpat tinal’oemaeh ila.
minatini’ kamanra:an niSo’ tatini’ a tomal ay ’iniSo’?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: yako ’aehae’ kinkaboehoel o moneSpat masa’ kin’ibabaw.
honaehnge: ila ’okay kakita’, So’o nakhara ’ibabaw ila?
S.TRANSL: 好久沒有相見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: ’ihi’ a! yako ’aehae’ kinkaboehoel o mato:ol masa’ kin’ibabaw ila.
yako ’am rima’ ray kapatawawan komi:im ka kamatortoroe’.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.
他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.
tapaS在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is tapaS? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: siya ray kapakba:awan, ya:o taSakobae:aeh hi siya.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: ya:o ’am minSa’la’ bae:iw ka kinsi’ael, ’insa’an rima’ komi:im ’iSo’on.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.
Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: So’o ki:im ka ’aroma’, yako ’am rima’ komi:im ka kamatortoroe’.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.
No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: ray ka’a’inola’an ka hahila: So’o ’am ’a’inola’ ay?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: ray ka’a’inola’an ka hahila: So’o ’am ’a’inola’ ay?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: ’ita’ ray ka’a’inola’an ka hahila: ’am powa’ ka kano’?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: ’ita’ ray ka’a’inola’an ka hahila: ’am tibtibae:iw ka kasi’aelen ay?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?
你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: ’oka’, baba:aw siya kaSlatar ila, hae:wan ila ’am lobih. .
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: siya ray minaypoSal tinaew’an, So’o Sa’ila ki:im hi siya.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: hayza’ ay ka mae’iyaeh ray taew’an?
’ataw o, honaehnge: ila ’okay kita’ ’iSo’on. So’o kayzaeh ay?
S.TRANSL: 是'ataw阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s ’ataw. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: kayzaeh a! ya:o mowa:i’ ’am ’a’iyalatar ki So’o.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: siya ray katalekan homangra: ka tatimae’, ya:o takobae:aeh hi siya.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: siya rima’ ray kawnatata:a’an romakep ka tata:a’.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: nimon baki’ ’okik ’ay taew’an, siya ray pinatiyayan, moyo ’ay taew’an ’ayna:a’ hi siya.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.
I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: komita’ So’o mowa:i’ yako kin Siyae’.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.
這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: honaehnge: ila ’okay wa:i’, ya:o takobae:aeh ka saboeh mowa:i’ ma’onhael somi’ael.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: ’izi’ ila patawaw, ya:o milkashaw ma’ kayzaeh ila, ’ita’ ta’a’iyalatar ray kinbaki’an.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: hini tata:a’ baba:aw hiwa’en, be:ayen ’iniSo’ ’alibihin si’aelen.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: ’ita’ rim’aen hila:an ta kakita’ kayzaeh ay?
S.TRANSL: 我們明天下午來碰面好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: ’ita’ ta kakita’ ’ay kakiSka:atan kayzaeh ay? yami ’am ’omalingo’.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: nak’isaza ray kararotonan ’am kayzaeh, yako ’am homiba: ’inoka SaySiyat a kayba:en.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: ray niya’om hito’ Singil So: minpongaeh kayzaeh a tomalan kita’en. So: minpongaeh ila So’o wa’ila ki:im ’iyakin!
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: nak’isaza ’am mayna:a’ tabin ray naba:an, honaehnge: a tomal!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?
那你巴斯達隘的時候來吧!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!
請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.
Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: yako maSriyae’ ’inmana’a hito’, ma’ ’iyakina matawaw no hito’ ma’an.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: So’o ra:am a tomal tomnon, hiya’ tomotoroe’ ’iSo’on?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: koko’ ma’an, siya ray niya’om hito’ ’ima wa’isan tomnon.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.
How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: tomnon ka kayba:en koSa’en niya’om kaspengan, yako ’iyakina pataSilotor ka kaspengan.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: So’o wa’isan, hini ’am honaehnge: ay ’am poSak?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ’oka’, ’aehae’ ka Sinangayan ma’ kayzaeh ila. ho’ol pilwaha:anen, ’isa:a’ pa’oSa’en ka tatamol ’ilo’en, ’isa:a’ kayzaeh ila ’aSkanen ray totowih ’izo’.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: ma’an hini hayza’ ka silih ki ’oe’oeng, saboeh yako nonak pinamowa’ o!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: yako minowa’ ka hini kayba:en, ’am koza’ rayhil?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，要多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: wa’isan a tomalan , waelae’ sowiti’ kayzaeh ay?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?
No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.
好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: yako ’am bae:iw hini ka malat ki hini koloban.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: saboeh ’am roSa’ siyaen rayhil, hini yako nonak pinaskayzaeh.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: yako komobae:aeh ka kapa’onhaelan mowa:i’ bae:iw, kayzaeh ay waelae’ naehan?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?
Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: wa’ila kita’ o! hayza’ ka kayba:en ki tatpo’ katibae:iwen.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: kayba:en so’hae’ to:o’ o monaseb rayhil, to:o’ ka kayba:en ’am ’aehae’ siyaen rayhil.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: yako bae:iw so’hae’ nanaw, be:ay ’iyakin ’ima SaSo’.
S.TRANSL: 我只買一件，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: So’o kayzaeh, yako ’iyakina bae:iw ka Sinpaehpae: ki mae’aew ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: Sinpaehpae: Sitil’amet ila. yako hayza’ naehan ka tani’ piyang, So’o ’am bae:iw ay?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: ’a:ay, be:ay so’hae’ ’iniman, yako rim’aen ila mowa:i’ bae:iw ka Sinpaehpae:.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我明天再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: ’a:ay, ya:o noka bilas potoyon ’iniSo’, nakhini monaseb rayhil.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
